title: Teen who shot 3 people in Texas mall charged with murder
description: The 16-year-old El Paso, Texas, boy who shot and killed 17-year-old Angeles Zaragoza and wounded two others has been charged with murder and three aggravated assault counts

title: Mississippi pastor accused of sexual battery held without bond
description: A Mississippi youth pastor accused of sexual battery is being held without bond. The pastor was accused of having sex with a 16-year-old church member on two occasions.

title: Florida teacher's aide violently attacked after taking student's Nintendo Switch
description: Florida deputies released surveillance video of a student attacking a high school teacher's aide who took away his Nintendo Switch during class time.

title: Commissioner joins Reno mayor in lawsuit accusing PI of vehicle tracking
description: A Nevada commissioner joined the Reno mayor in a lawsuit alleging a private investigator put tracking devices on their vehicles. The mayor said the tracking caused severe distress.

title: Padres' Manny Machado becomes first victim of MLB's new pitch clock
description: Major League Baseball spring training is underway, and so are the new rules in the sport, including a pitch clock. Well, it's going to take the San Diego Padres' Manny Machado some getting used to.

title: Rhode Island man caught with 665,000 meth-laced fake Adderall pills gets 10 years
description: Dylan Rodas of Cumberland, Rhode Island, was sentenced to ten years in prison after pleading guilty to possession of nearly 700,000 fake Adderall pills laced with methamphetamine.

title: Paris Hilton says she had her baby via surrogate because of teenage abuse, other 'trauma': 'I want a family'
description: Paris Hilton said after suffering sexual abuse, including late-night gynecological exams at a boarding school as a teen, she decided to have her first baby via surrogate.

title: Yemeni rebels frustrated by leader's calls to delay seccession
description: Southern separatists in Yemen condemned statements by a close ally insinuating that secession from the Houthi rebel-dominated north of the country should be delayed.

title: Sixers' Georges Niang dishes on ex-teammate Ben Simmons' drama: He ‘kind of handicapped us’
description: Georges Niang of the Philadelphia 76ers says former teammate Ben Simmons, now with the Brooklyn Nets, handicapped the Sixers at the beginning of the 2021-22 season.

title: University of Kent in UK encourages gender-neutral pronouns among students, staff: Consider ‘ze’ and ‘fae’
description: The University of Kent in the UK released a set of guidelines on gender pronouns, warning that proper pronoun usage is a matter of “human dignity."

title: New York City employee who killed alleged robber has murder charge dropped
description: New York City fish market employee Junior Aquino Hernandez is no longer being charged with murder after stabbing and killing an alleged robber during an altercation Tuesday night.

title: Biden to draw health care contrast with GOP in Virginia
description: Biden is trying to draw a contrast of health care priorities with the Republicans in Virginia. The administration claims GOP plans will raise health care prices.

title: Indiana authorities identify cause of October fire that razed neighborhood
description: The cause of an October fire that destroyed an Evansville, Indiana, warehouse and several surrounding homes was likely electrical, authorities say.

title: Troubled boxer Gervonta Davis hit with lawsuit; his punch allegedly injured parking attendant
description: On the same day it was announced he would fight fellow undefeated boxer Ryan Garcia, Gervonta Davis is being sued for allegedly sucker-punching a parking attendant.

title: Chicago man charged in slain police officer Ella French's death claims no bail condition is 'excessive'
description: A man linked to the killing of a Chicago police officer is asking to be released on bond after a court petition claimed no bail prior to his trial in "excessive."

title: Montana man charged for violent threats to Democratic US senator
description: A Montana man has been charged with with threatening the life of a Democratic U.S. senator. The man left muliple voicemail threats to injure and murder the U.S. Senator.

title: Ex-felon accidently shoots himself at Las Vegas Strip casino
description: An ex-felon accidentally shot himself at a Las Vegas Strip casino on Tuesday. The man had an unregistered handgun in his pants which left him hospitalized and in critical condition.

title: China unveils peace plan to wary Zelenskyy
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy is cautiously welcoming of prospective Chinese involvement in brokering a peace deal in the ongoing Russo-Ukrainian conflict.

title: Erin Brockovich visits East Palestine after toxic train derailment: 'All clear my a--!'
description: Environmental activist Erin Brockovich is hosting a town hall on Friday evening following the disastrous train derailment in East Palestine, Ohio.

title: Florida man sentenced to 7 years for stealing $2.6M of COVID-19 relief funds
description: A Florida man was sentenced to seven years for stealing $2.6 million in COVID-19 relief funds. The man pleaded guilty to wire and bank fraud, along with illegal monetary transaction.

title: Lisa Marie Presley's daughter Riley Keough stuns at first red carpet since mom's death
description: Lisa Marie's daughter Riley Keough stunned as she attended the premiere of "Daisy Jones & the Six" in Hollywood on Thursday. It was her first red carpet appearance since her mother's death in January.

title: California school district presentation divides students into categories of 'privilege' or 'oppression'
description: Students at a California school district were given a presentation on oppression that listed groups who would be considered part of an oppressed 'target group.'

title: Italy's high court upholds tough prison regime for militant
description: Italy's high court has upheld a tough prison regime for an Italian left-wing militant. The man has been on hunger strike since October to protest the prison regime for terrorists.

title: Drone strike in Syria kills 2 al-Qaida-linked operatives
description: A drone strike in Syria has killed two al-Qaida-linked operatives riding a motorcycle. The attack was believed to have been carried out by the U.S.-led coalition.

title: Kentucky Senate approves liability insurance coverage for teachers
description: The Kentucky Senate voted to provide liability insurance coverage for teachers. School districts will provides coverage amounting to at least $1 million.

title: Georgia ex-teacher sexually assaulted and 'groomed' minors: authorities
description: A former Georgia choir teacher received a 20-year sentence after pleading guilty to sexually assaulting several students who were minors.

title: Retired judge selected to review Arizona’s execution process
description: It was announced that a retired judge will review Arizona’s execution process ordered by Gov. Katie Hobbs. This examination follows the state's history of mismanaging executions.

title: Boston officials warn of fentanyl-laced cocaine, overdose spike
description: Boston public health officials are warning care providers about a sudden spike in drug overdoses that may be attributable to fentanyl-laced cocaine.

title: 'Friends' star Courteney Cox shows off fit figure as a 'Gen Z girl'
description: Baby Boomer and "Friends" star Courteney Cox wore a crop top and flashed a peace sign in her humorous attempt to look like a "Gen Z girl" on Instagram.

title: Trump's stance on ending Ukraine aid could box in DeSantis: WSJ columnist
description: An editorial board member from the Wall Street Journal blasted both Trump's foreign policy record and his messaging, urging future GOP leaders to try another geopolitical route.

title: 2 Wisconsin officers charged in prisoner's overdose death

title: UN condemns Haitian gang violence spike
description: Haitian gang Baz Gran Grif has taken control of numerous communities, killing at least 69 people and leaving several police stations abandoned as a result.

title: Virginia Tech crowd goes nuts as missed free throws trigger promo: 'Bacon for everybody!'
description: The Virginia Tech home crowd took home free bacon after two missed free throws by Miami late in the second half of their ACC conference game on Tuesday triggered a promotion. The Hurricanes defeated the Hokies 76-70.

title: Could a urine test detect pancreatic and prostate cancer? Study shows 99% success rate
description: A simple urine test could detect pancreatic and prostate cancer with up to a 99% rate of accuracy, says a new study from the Korea Institute of Materials Science. Other experts weigh in.

title: Fallout from toxic Ohio train crash could be a preview of 2024 presidential race
description: The tragedy surrounding the train derailment in East Palestine, Ohio has become the backdrop in the 2024 presidential race, giving Americans a preview of what to expect as it heats up.

title: Reporter's Notebook: What Russia can and can't afford
description: Vladimir Putin wants Russians to feel like there is no war and life is normal. But how long can it last? Economic editor Peter Mironenko on Putin’s purse strings.

title: California man who accused twin brother of 2 rapes in 1990s is convicted of crimes
description: Kevin Konther was convicted of two rapes in the 1990s after he accused his twin brother of committing the crimes. DNA evidence linked both brothers to the rapes.

title: 'The Shining' star Shelley Duvall shares stories about working with the 'classic' Jack Nicholson
description: Shelley Duvall shared with Fox News Digital what it was like to work alongside Jack Nicholson in "The Shining" in 1980 as she returns to the big screen for the first time in 20 years.

title: University of North Carolina moves to ban ‘diversity, equity and inclusion’ statements in anti-woke backlash
description: The University of North Carolina this week voted to ban 'diversity, equity and inclusion statements' and politically preferential hiring.

title: Judge appointed in Missouri case to remove Dem attorney Kim Gardner from office
description: The Missouri Supreme Court appointed judge John P. Torbitzky to preside over the Missouri Attorney General's case to have the St. Louis circuit attorney removed from office.

title: Alabama's Nate Oats defends playing Brandon Miller amid link to deadly shooting: 'We've done the right thing'
description: Police have said they will not be charging Brandon Miller with any crime based on evidence they have. So he continues to play for the University of Alabama basketball team.

title: Laxatives taken on consistent basis could increase dementia risk, new study finds
description: Older adults who take laxatives on a regular basis could face a 51% higher risk of developing dementia compared to those who do not use them, a new study indicates.

title: ‘Harry Potter’ actress defends JK Rowling’s views, warns about cancel culture: ‘Next step is violence’
description: "Harry Potter" actress Evanna Lynch spoke out against cancel culture and defended author J.K. Rowling in a recent interview with U.K. outlet The Telegraph.

title: Shakira scorches ex Gerard Piqué in song after being ‘hurt’ over his new girlfriend
description: Colombian singer Shakira teamed up with artist Karol G for the new single titled "TQG." The track slams Shakira's ex Gerard Piqué for having a new girlfriend.

title: Idaho murders: Bryan Kohberger leaks 'huge issue' with 'potential to compromise' prosecution, lawyer warns
description: A lawyer warns that the case against Idaho murders suspect Bryan Kohberger could be compromised because of sources leaking information in the investigation.

title: California Gov. Newsom's latest war on oil is off to a rough start
description: California Gov. Gavin Newsom's plan to limit oil companies' profits was met with criticism by Democrats, Republicans and experts alike at a state hearing earlier this week.

title: Alaska's ACLU sues corrections agency for violating the rights of incarcerated people
description: Alaska's ACLU is suing the corrections agency on behalf of four plaintiffs who claim they were denied access to transitional programs after their release date was moved up.

title: Minor league club Indianapolis Indians announce team name will not be changed
description: The Indianapolis Indians, the Triple-A affiliate of the Pittsburgh Pirates, announced they will not be changing their controversial name.

title: Former WNBA MVP Nneka Ogwumike returning to Los Angeles Sparks on 1-year deal: report
description: After last year's final Sparks game, Nneka Ogwumike said she would be back. On Friday, the former MVP delivered on her promise by signing a one-year contract with LA.

title: New 'historical character' American Girl dolls from the 1990s have millennials feeling old and 'disrespected'
description: The release of two "historical" American Girl dolls from the 1990s — dolls named Isabel and Nicki Hoffman — is making some millennial women feel quite old.

title: North Carolina juvenile with AR-15 detained at high school basketball game
description: A North Carolina juvenile with an AR-15 was detained Thursday night at a high school basketball game. Police responded to a call saying the suspect brought the gun to school.

title: US Court strikes down rule requiring charter boats to have tracking
description: The U.S. Court voted down a rule that would have required charter boats to be equipped with tracking. This was a victory for charter operators who challenged the rule with a 2020 lawsuit.

description: The North Carolina House Speaker and another lawmaker were uninjured after their SUV was rammed on the highway. The driver was charged with impaired driving and other counts.

description: Jeff Titus, 71, was released from a Michigan prison after a judge voided a 2002 double homicide conviction that Titus long maintained was erroneous.

description: The Pennsylvania House passed two pieces of legislation Friday that would allow victims to sue over currently-outdated child sex abuse claims.

description: Jeff Hardy was charged with his third DUI within the last decade, but he pleaded no contest, which helped him avoid jail time. His driver's license is suspended for a decade.

description: A new draft guidance issued by the Food and Drug Administration says plant-based milk companies can call their products milk because people already refer to the drinks as milk.

description: A schizophrenic Wisconsin man was charged with attempted homicide after he attacked his mother with hammer Jan.26. The man's bail has been set at $1 million in cash.

description: Mozambique was hit with Tropical Cyclone Freddy on Friday. The storm dumped dangerous amounts of rain and wreaked havoc across southern Africa.

description: The King Road home near the University of Idaho campus where four students were killed in November has been boarded up and fenced in as the suspect remains jailed.

description: Ashley Bennett said on "Fox & Friends" Friday that she's not surprised by Behar's comments, but she stressed the need to put politics aside.
